content.description: Stand start with hands on the shield's opposing sidepulls. From there, climb up and slightly right using an assortment of edges and bumps to reach a formidable topout.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is clear, but it does slope away from the problem.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Arcadia.

content.description:
Sit start with a right hand on the arete and a left hand gaston. From there, pull up to a left hand on the arete (crux), then follow the arete on good edges to a natural break before the apex, use the shallow bumps to pull around the arete, and top it out.

Pulling off the ground from an actual sit start gives the problem its difficulty.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine, the landing is very good.
content.location: It ascends the southwest arete of Arcadia.

content.description:
Son of Hands gollums out from a shallow cave and finishes via perfect edges on a clean slab face.

Sit start with hands matched on an obvious jug in the cave. From there, move right to an incut edge with both hands, walk the feet over and make a big move to a perfect crimp on the face, set the feet and make another big, static move to a three-finger crimp (crux?), then paste a foot on the face, make a stab for the lip or cross over with the right, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will do, the landing is good, but there are a few rocks below the problem.
content.location:
It ascends the east face of Arcadia. It shares the same start with

Paleocontact

.

content.description: Sit start with hand matched on an obvious jug in the cave. From there, come out and match hands on a fantastic, incut edge (crux), then follow with another match on the good edge up and to the left (slightly cramped territory, as the boulder behind the problem is very close). After that, hit the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two should do it, the landing is pretty good.
content.location: Ascend the northeast face of Arcadia Block.

content.description:
Fantods ascends a perfect undercut arete that leads to a vertical/slab face on solid sandstone edges.

Stand start on the east side of the northeast arete with a left hand undercling/sidepull and a right hand on the arete. From there, work a few smears, achieve a right foot edge, then bump the right hand up the arete (crux?), hit a left hand crimp, then stand tall to diagonal left hand rail (crux?), follow up the arete with the right hand, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is good, but there are a few rocks behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the northeast arete of Arcadia Block.

content.description:
Pessomancy climbs an arete distinguished by a large, nose-shaped feature. The rock quality is perfect, the movement is interesting, and the landing is good.

Stand start with a high left hand on the arete's nose and a right hand on an undercling on the face. From there, match the right hand on the arete, make a big move up to a right hand gaston, position a knee on the nose to manage a smear next to the left hand, then bump the left hand up the arete next to the right, stand up and reach the lip, and mantle atop the boulder.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing is flat but is composed of several rocks.
content.location: It climbs the northeast arete of Aracadia.

content.description:
Chronoception climbs a short, slightly overhung section of highly featured rock, over a good landing.

Stand start with a high pair of irregular micro-edges. From there, stick a short but blind left hand move to a small edge on the arete. Square up, follow with another short move to a right hand sidepull, follow to a higher left hand dimple-edge on the arete, bump the right hand up through a series of edges to a good rail before the lip, match on it, and then commit to the final slab with a mantel.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The immediate fall zone is great, but there are some rocks present, and the landing slopes away slightly.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Arcadia's west face.

content.description: Stand start with opposing sidepulls on the black shield. From there, traverse right along good edges, continue trending right and up, and top out to the right at the arete's relief.
content.protection: A pair of pads should do it, the landing is pretty good.
content.location: It climbs the southern section of Arcadia's west face.
